newsitem.title: USA: CenCor net assets in liquidation equal $17.4 mln.
newsitem.headline: CenCor net assets in liquidation equal $17.4 mln.

text.p: CenCor Inc said the value of its net assets in liquidation as of December 31, 1996 decreased to $17.4 million or about $11.69 per share from $18.1 million or $12.17 per share the prior year.
As previously reported, the company is in the process of liquidation and is expected to be fully liquidated by October 1999.
It said the decrease in net assets in liquidation is attributable to expenses from liquidation activities exceeding income from liquidation activities for the period.

The actual amount to be received upon complete liquidation may be hurt by claims arising from indemnification obligations resulting from the sale of the assets of CenCor's former Century Acceptance Corp subsidiary.

CenCor said Century has agreed to a settlement in two Alabama class-action lawsuits for which it was a defendant. While Century denied any wrongdoing, it said it settled the cases to avoid the time and expense of litigation.
